Bacon Jam on Toast

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your toast game to unimaginable heights? Introducing the irresistible Bacon Jam on Toast, a savory-sweet delight that will leave your taste buds dancing and your brunch guests begging for more! This delectable spread combines crispy bacon, caramelized onions, and a touch of maple syrup and apple cider vinegar, creating a mouthwatering jam that perfectly complements a warm slice of toasted bread. Perfect for breakfast, brunch, or even as a unique appetizer at your next gathering, this recipe is not only easy to make but also packed with flavor. With just a handful of ingredients, you can whip up this luxurious treat in under an hour. Whether you're a bacon lover or simply looking to impress your friends with a gourmet touch, this Bacon Jam on Toast is sure to become your new go-to recipe. Read on to discover how to make this delicious spread and transform your toast into a culinary masterpiece!

Ingredients

bacon

Use thick-cut bacon for a richer flavor and better texture. If you want a healthier option, turkey bacon or a plant-based bacon substitute can be used, but adjust cooking times as these alternatives may not render fat in the same way.

onion

Sweet onions like Vidalia or Walla Walla are excellent for caramelizing due to their natural sweetness. If you prefer a sharper flavor, yellow onions work well too. You can substitute with shallots for a more delicate taste.

brown sugar

If you don’t have brown sugar, you can substitute with white sugar mixed with a little molasses (1 cup white sugar + 1 tablespoon molasses for 1 cup brown sugar). Coconut sugar is a great alternative for a lower glycemic index.

maple syrup

Pure maple syrup is best for authentic flavor, but honey or agave syrup can be used as substitutes. If you're aiming for a sugar-free version, consider using a sugar-free maple syrup.

apple cider vinegar

You can substitute apple cider vinegar with white wine vinegar or even balsamic vinegar for a different flavor profile. For a milder taste, rice vinegar can also work.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper will enhance the flavor more than pre-ground pepper. If you want a little heat, consider adding a pinch of cayenne pepper or using white pepper for a subtler flavor.

salt

Adjust the salt based on the saltiness of the bacon used. For a gourmet touch, consider using smoked salt to enhance the overall flavor profile.

bread (for toasting)

Choose a hearty bread like sourdough, ciabatta, or a rustic country loaf for a better texture and flavor contrast. Gluten-free bread can also be used for a gluten-free option.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the Bacon

    In a large skillet, cook 1 lb of bacon over medium heat until crispy. This should take about 8-10 minutes. Be sure to turn the bacon occasionally for even cooking. Once done, remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside, but leave the bacon grease in the pan for flavor.

  • Step 2: Sauté the Onions

    In the same skillet with the bacon grease, add 1 large chopped onion. Sauté the onion over medium heat for about 10 minutes until it becomes soft and caramelized. Stir occasionally to avoid burning and to ensure even cooking.

  • Step 3: Combine Bacon and Onions

    Chop the cooked bacon into small, bite-sized pieces and return it to the skillet with the caramelized onions.

  • Step 4: Add Sweetness and Flavor

    Stir in 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1/4 cup of maple syrup, 1/4 cup of apple cider vinegar, 1/2 tsp of black pepper, and 1/2 tsp of salt. Cook this mixture for an additional 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens up and the flavors meld together.

  • Step 5: Pulse to Desired Consistency

    Allow the mixture to cool slightly before transferring it to a food processor. Pulse it until you achieve your desired consistency—smooth or slightly chunky, based on your preference.

  • Step 6: Toast the Bread

    Toast 4 slices of your favorite bread until golden brown. You can use sourdough, whole wheat, or even a rustic baguette.

  • Step 7: Serve and Enjoy

    Spread the bacon jam generously on the warm toasted bread. Serve immediately while warm for the best flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I cook bacon properly without making a mess?

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. This helps render the fat gradually, preventing splatter. If you find splatters unavoidable, you can cover the skillet with a splatter screen.

What’s the best way to chop an onion without crying?

Chill the onion in the fridge for about 30 minutes before chopping. Also, using a sharp knife can help reduce cell damage and minimize tears.

How can I tell when my onions are properly caramelized?

Onions are caramelized when they turn a deep golden brown and have a sweet, rich flavor. This usually takes about 10 minutes over medium heat, but watch closely to avoid burning.

What should I do if my bacon jam is too thick?

If your bacon jam is too thick, you can add a splash of water or additional apple cider vinegar while cooking to reach your desired consistency.

Is it safe to eat raw bacon?

No, raw bacon can contain harmful bacteria. Always cook bacon until it is crispy and has an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C) for safety.

How can I cleanly transfer the bacon jam to the food processor?

Let the bacon jam cool slightly to make it easier to handle. Use a spatula to scoop it into the food processor, or if the skillet has a pouring spout, you can carefully pour it in.

What type of bread is best for toasting with bacon jam?

Any sturdy bread works well, but sourdough or a thick white bread will hold the bacon jam nicely and provide a great texture.

Can I store leftover bacon jam? How long does it last?

Yes, you can store leftover bacon jam in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. It also freezes well for up to 3 months.

What can I serve with bacon jam besides toast?

Bacon jam is delicious on burgers, grilled cheese sandwiches, or as a topping for crackers and cheese. Get creative with its use!

How do I know when my bacon jam is done cooking?

Your bacon jam is done when it has thickened to your liking, usually around 10-15 minutes after adding the other ingredients. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is not suitable for vegetarians or vegans due to the bacon. However, a vegetarian alternative could be made using smoked mushrooms or tempeh in place of bacon, and a vegan version of the jam could use maple syrup without any animal products. Gluten-free bread can be used to accommodate those with gluten sensitivities. Adjustments in the sugar content can be made for those monitoring their sugar intake.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing, serve the Bacon Jam on Toast with a side of creamy goat cheese or a soft, spreadable cheese like Brie to balance the salty sweetness. A fresh arugula salad with a lemon vinaigrette adds a peppery contrast. For beverages, craft beers such as a malty brown ale or a fruity IPA work beautifully, as well as a lightly chilled red wine like a Pinot Noir. If you’re looking for something non-alcoholic, try a sparkling apple cider for a refreshing complement.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Bacon Jam on Toast as an appetizer or a brunch dish, garnished with fresh herbs like chives or parsley for a pop of color. For a more substantial meal, top the toast with a poached egg and a sprinkle of chili flakes. Arrange the toasted slices on a wooden board with small bowls of pickles or olives for a rustic presentation, or serve them as part of a charcuterie board with assorted meats and cheeses.

#

Bacon Jam on Toast

40 min
$10
300 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

None

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

BreakfastSnack

Tags:

QuickEasySavoryBreakfast

Description

A sweet and savory spread made from crispy bacon, perfect for topping your favorite toast!

Ingredients

  • bacon: 1 lb
  • onion: 1 large
  • brown sugar: 1/2 cup
  • maple syrup: 1/4 cup
  • apple cider vinegar: 1/4 cup
  • black pepper: 1/2 tsp
  • salt: 1/2 tsp
  • bread (for toasting): 4 slices

Date Created:

11/22/2024
